prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Alderman Kyubi was murdered with a spear that had been on the wall.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: The fingerprints of the defendant, Damian Tenma, were found on the murder weapon.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, Alderman Kyubi was asleep from a drug he unwittingly ingested.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mayor Tenma attacked his helpless victim, impaling him like a human shish kebob!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: But the sudden pain jolted the victim awake, and he grabbed a statue and struck back!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder case, and I need to identify a pair where the evidence and testimony contradict each other. 

First, I'll start by understanding the case. The victim is Alderman Kyubi, who was stabbed with a spear. The defendant is Mayor Damian Tenma. The testimonies provided by Detective Bobby Fulbright outline the events as he perceives them. 

Looking at the testimonies:
- Testimony 0 states that the murder weapon was a spear that had been on the wall.
- Testimony 1 mentions that Mayor Tenma's fingerprints were found on the spear.
- Testimony 2 indicates that the victim was asleep due to a drug he ingested.
- Testimony 3 describes the mayor attacking the victim while he was helpless.
- Testimony 4 suggests that the victim woke up and struck back with a statue.

Now, examining the evidence:
- Evidence 7 is described as a statue that was used to bludgeon the mayor. It mentions that the mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. Additionally, it was wrapped in a large cloth, and Jinxie is the only one who knows what the original looked like.

The contradiction arises between Testimony 4 and Evidence 7. Testimony 4 claims that the victim grabbed a statue and struck back, implying that the statue was used by the victim to defend himself. However, Evidence 7 indicates that the statue was used to bludgeon the mayor, suggesting that the mayor was the one struck, not the victim. This inconsistency points to a contradiction because the testimony suggests the victim used the statue, while the evidence shows the statue was used against the mayor.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm presented with a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder case. My task is to identify one pair where an evidence contradicts a testimony. 

First, I'll start by understanding the characters involved. There's Trucy Wright, Jinxie Tenma, The Amazing Nine-Tails, Damian Tenma, Rex Kyubi, Athena Cykes, Phineas Filch, Bobby Fulbright, Florent L'Belle, Phoenix Wright, and Simon Blackquill. The victim is Rex Kyubi, the alderman of Nine-Tails Vale, and the main suspect seems to be Damian Tenma, the mayor.

Next, I'll go through the list of evidences. There are 21 pieces of evidence, ranging from an Attorney's Badge to various items found at the crime scene, like the Fox and Demon Statue, which is noted as the murder weapon. There's also a mention of a blackmail letter and hand cream with a specific logo.

Now, looking at the testimonies, there are five statements from Bobby Fulbright. He claims that the case revolves around opposition to a municipal merger, that Mayor Tenma panicked due to The Amazing Nine-Tails emboldening protestors, that the mayor fabricated a monster to stoke fears, planted evidence like feathers and tracks, and ultimately killed the alderman after planting this evidence.

To find a contradiction, I need to find an evidence that directly opposes one of these testimonies. Let's examine each testimony and see if there's an evidence that challenges it.

1. **Testimony 0**: The case centers on opposition to the municipal merger. While there's no direct evidence contradicting this motive, it's more of a background statement.

2. **Testimony 1**: Mayor Tenma panicked because The Amazing Nine-Tails emboldened protestors. Again, this is about motive and not directly contradicted by a physical evidence.

3. **Testimony 2**: The mayor fabricated a monster to stoke fears. This is supported by evidence like the Yokai Legend Scroll (Evidence 1) and the Tenma Taro Warding Charm (Evidence 2), which are related to the yokai legend. However, if the mayor fabricated the monster, but there's evidence of actual yokai-related items, it might support Fulbright's claim rather than contradict it.

4. **Testimony 3**: The mayor planted strange feathers and tracks to make it look like a yokai did it. Here, Evidence 8 (Golden Fur) and Evidence 9 (Crime Photo showing black feathers) could be the planted evidence. However, if the feathers and fur are present, it supports Fulbright's testimony unless there's evidence showing they weren't planted.

5. **Testimony 4**: The mayor killed the sleeping alderman after planting the evidence. The key evidence here would be the murder weapon and any evidence showing the mayor's presence. Evidence 7 (Fox and Demon Statue) is the murder weapon with the mayor's blood but no fingerprints. This could support the testimony if the mayor used it.

Looking for contradictions, I need to find an evidence that directly opposes a testimony. For example, if Fulbright claims the mayor planted feathers, but evidence shows that the feathers were naturally present or from another source, that would be a contradiction.

However, in this case, most of the evidence seems to support Fulbright's testimonies rather than contradict them. The presence of feathers and fur aligns with the idea that the mayor planted evidence to frame a yokai. The lack of fingerprints on the murder weapon could suggest the mayor was careful, but it doesn't directly contradict the testimony.

Perhaps the key is in the Forbidden Chamber Key (Evidence 17), which the mayor swallowed. If the key is unique and only the mayor had it, it supports the idea that he was involved. However, it doesn't contradict the testimony about planting evidence.

After reviewing, the strongest link is that Fulbright's testimonies are supported by the evidence rather than being contradicted. Therefore, there might not be a direct contradiction, but if I have to choose, the closest would be the presence of yokai-related items contradicting the claim that the mayor fabricated the monster. However, this is speculative.

Given the options, I'll conclude that Evidence 7 (Fox and Demon Statue) contradicts Testimony 4 because the statue was used as the murder weapon, but Fulbright's testimony suggests the mayor used it after planting evidence, which aligns rather than contradicts.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through all the information provided.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Trucy Wright, Jinxie Tenma, The Amazing Nine-Tails, Damian Tenma, Rex Kyubi, Athena Cykes, Phineas Filch, Bobby Fulbright, Florent L'Belle, Phoenix Wright, and Simon Blackquill. The victim is Rex Kyubi, and the main suspect seems to be Damian Tenma, the mayor.

Now, looking at the evidences:

- **Evidence 0**: Attorney's Badge – This is just a standard badge, not directly relevant to the contradiction.
- **Evidence 1**: Yokai Legend Scroll – Describes Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. It mentions that Tenma Taro has black feathers and yellow talons and doesn't wield a weapon. This is important because it sets a description of what the demon looks like.
- **Evidence 2**: Tenma Taro Warding Charm – Given by Jinxie, but not directly contradictory.
- **Evidence 3**: Nine-Tails Flower – Not relevant to contradiction.
- **Evidence 4**: Special Edition Paper – Shows a photo of Tenma Taro, but again, not directly contradictory.
- **Evidence 5**: Crime Scene Diagram – Shows the layout, but not contradictory.
- **Evidence 6**: Foyer Diagram – Layout of the foyer, not directly contradictory.
- **Evidence 7**: Fox and Demon Statue – This is crucial. It's a statue of Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. It was used to bludgeon the mayor, and the mayor's blood was found on it. Importantly, no fingerprints were found, and it was wrapped in a large cloth. This evidence suggests that the statue was the murder weapon.
- **Evidence 8**: Golden Fur – Found at the scene, but not directly contradictory.
- **Evidence 9**: Crime Photo – Shows the crime scene with bloody footprints and black feathers. The victim is on a table with a spear, and another man is on the sofa with blood on his head. Neither are wearing gloves.
- **Evidence 10**: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask – Found by the riverside with white hair inside. This suggests it might have been at the crime scene.
- **Evidence 11**: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy – Photo of the wrestler, not directly contradictory.
- **Evidence 12**: Jinxie's Statement – She saw a demon fleeing toward the foyer.
- **Evidence 13**: TV Listings – Filch's guide shows a circled wrestling match at 3 PM. Apollo notices this and asks Filch about it. Filch admits he watched a disastrous match, claiming he could have done better.
- **Evidence 14**: Kyubi's Autopsy Report – Cause of death: stabbed with a spear around 3:20 PM. The victim was in a drug-induced sleep.
- **Evidence 15**: Blackmail Letter – Found in Kyubi's pocket, likely taken by L'Belle.
- **Evidence 16**: Village Superstitions – Not directly contradictory.
- **Evidence 17**: Forbidden Chamber Key – The mayor swallowed it, no fingerprints.
- **Evidence 18**: Couleur Me L'Belle! – Hair color by L'Belle, not available publicly.
- **Evidence 19**: Hand Cream – Dropped in the Forbidden Chamber, bears L'Belle's logo.
- **Evidence 20**: Forbidden Chamber Figure – Azuki Kozo figure left inside the statue.

Now, looking at the testimonies:

- **Testimony 0**: Filch claims he was on guard duty in the foyer as requested by Kyubi.
- **Testimony 1**: Filch says he was ensuring no one could get to their guest.
- **Testimony 2**: Filch claims he was in his office keeping watch when the murder happened after 3 PM.
- **Testimony 3**: Filch says he didn't see anything out of the ordinary.

From the testimonies, Filch is saying he was in the foyer, specifically in his office, during the time of the murder, which was around 3:20 PM. He claims he didn't see anything unusual.

Looking back at the evidence, **Evidence 13**: TV Listings shows that at 3 PM, there was a pro wrestling match that Filch watched. Apollo questions Filch about it, and Filch admits he watched the match, calling it a disaster and saying he could have done better.

This creates a contradiction. If Filch was watching the wrestling match at 3 PM, he couldn't have been in his office keeping watch at the same time. His testimony claims he was in the foyer/office, but the evidence shows he was occupied watching TV, which would mean he wasn't actively guarding the area as he claimed.

So, **Evidence 13** (TV Listings) contradicts **Testimony 2** (Filch's claim of being in his office keeping watch during the murder).
</think>

Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It's true, I was watching a pro wrestling match on the office TV.
Person: Filch
Testimony 1
Testimony: My eyes mighta been slacking off, but my ears? They were working overtime.
Person: Filch
Testimony 2
Testimony: The floor there's all creaky squeaky-like. No way I woulda missed someone walking by.
Person: Filch
Testimony 3
Testimony: If Tenma Taro was to pass by, his staff woulda gone jingle jangle.
Person: Filch
Testimony 4
Testimony: So ya see, there weren't no Tenma Taro in the foyer.
Person: Filch

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the scenario.

We have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder investigation in Nine-Tails Vale. The main characters involved include Trucy Wright, Jinxie Tenma, The Amazing Nine-Tails, Damian Tenma, Rex Kyubi, Athena Cykes, Phineas Filch, Bobby Fulbright, Florent L'Belle, Phoenix Wright, and Simon Blackquill.

The evidences include various items like an Attorney's Badge, Yokai Legend Scroll, Tenma Taro Warding Charm, Nine-Tails Flower, Special Edition Paper, Crime Scene Diagram, Foyer Diagram, Fox and Demon Statue, Golden Fur, Crime Photo, Amazing Nine-Tails Mask, Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy, Jinxie's Statement, TV Listings, Kyubi's Autopsy Report, Blackmail Letter, Village Superstitions, Forbidden Chamber Key, Couleur Me L'Belle!, Hand Cream, and Forbidden Chamber Figure.

The testimonies are from Phineas Filch, the caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He claims that at the time of the murder, he was watching a pro wrestling match on TV in his office, which is located in the foyer. He says his eyes might have been distracted, but his ears were alert and would have heard anyone passing by, especially if it were Tenma Taro, whose staff would have made noise.

Now, looking at the evidence, there's a TV Listings document (Evidence 13) that shows the schedule for "Temma Town Pro Wrestling" at 3 PM, which is around the time of the murder. Filch mentions watching this program, which suggests he was occupied during the crime.

However, there's also a Crime Scene Diagram (Evidence 5) and a Foyer Diagram (Evidence 6) that detail the layout of the crime scene and the foyer, including Filch's office. These diagrams might show that Filch's office is in a position where he would have had a clear view or hearing of anyone entering or exiting the area where the murder took place.

If Filch claims he was watching TV and didn't see or hear anything, but the diagrams show that his office is in a location where he should have been able to see or hear the events, that could be a contradiction. Additionally, the presence of the TV Listings showing the wrestling match he was watching might imply that he was distracted, but the diagrams might indicate he should have been aware of the events.

Another point is the testimony about the floor being creaky and the staff making noise. If the diagrams show that the floor is creaky or that the layout would make it hard to sneak past, but Filch still didn't notice anything, that could be contradictory.

Furthermore, the Golden Fur (Evidence 8) found at the scene might suggest that an animal or someone in a costume was present, which could relate to The Amazing Nine-Tails or Tenma Taro. If Filch's testimony doesn't account for this, it could be another point of contradiction.

So, considering all this, the main contradiction seems to be between Filch's testimony about not seeing or hearing anything and the evidence that suggests he should have been able to, given his location and the layout of the manor.
</think>
